subSubSection.paragraph:
Bombyx siva Lefèbvre, 1827
, Zool. Journ. 3 : 210 . TL: India . Holotype : male (probably lost).

References : Mirzayans and Kalali 1970 : 19 ; Rajabi 1986 : 169 ; Modarres Awal 1994 & 1997 : 209 . Distribution (Map 34 ): deserts and oases of Saudi Arabia , Iraq , Bahrain , Oman , Afghanistan , Pakistan and India . - In Iran : Qazvin, Esfehan, Fars , Khuzestan, Bushehr, Hormozgan, Kerman, Sistan va Baluchestan provinces.

Bionomics . This species is known from lowland areas to 800 m and is on the wing from April to October. Two or occasionally three generations per year. Caterpillars from different localities recorded on
Acacia
spp . ( Fabaceae = Leguminosae),
Terminalia
sp. (Comberitaceae),
Casuarina
sp. ( Casuarinaceae ),
Zizyphus spinachristi
( Rhamnaceae ),
Populus euphratica
and
Salix
spp . ( Salicaceae ),
Tamarix
( Tamaricaceae ),
Punica
( Punicaceae ),
Malus
and other fruit trees ( Rosaceae ),
Avicennia
(Avicennaceae) and
Prosopis stephaniana
(Leguminosae= Fabaceae ) (Wiltshire 1990 : 106 ). In Bahrain (Wiltshire 1964 ), the species has been recorded from
Casuarina
( Casuarinaceae ),
Zizyphus spina-christi
( Rhamnaceae ),
Prunus armeniacus
,
Prosopis stephansiana
(Leguminosae= Fabaceae ); in deserts larvae can be found often on the branches of
Acacia
and one caterpillar was also found on
Nerium oleander
. In Iran the following host plants are recorded: Egyptian acacia (
Albizzia lebbeck
: Mimosaceae ), mudar (
Calotropis procera
: Asclepiadaceae ), eucalyptus, screw bean (
Prosopis
sp.: Papilionaceae ), pomegranate (
Punica granatum
: Punicaceae ), willow, Christ’s thorn (
Paliurus spina-christi
( Rhamnaceae ),
Tamarix
,
Amygdalus spatiodes
,
Malus
sp. Pupa hibernates in a silky cocoon between leaves or on bank.
